content: @apiraino about rust-forge#546
left a comment
but after a @T-libs re-structure we would need to fix not only the forge procedure but also our queries
cc @Mara
hi
:wave:
@Mara saw your github comments
pretty clear, thanks
@apiraino you need to rename T-libs to T-libs-api and T-libs-impl to T-libs
everywhere, on forge procedure and on triagebot
thanks for clarifying. Also ref. to this topic
@apiraino @Mara about this conversation, one question ... should the compiler team still keep going through libs issues? or now with the reformulation of lib teams that's not necessary anymore?
I'm not sure if this was already discussed
maybe worth checking with pnkfelix too

but the main question I guess would be for @Mara, is the new libs team going over this stuff? do you think the compiler should also cover some parts of this? for more info check the compiler team meeting agenda and see which libs issues are there
https://hackmd.io/vQr9mk6zSdib5vg9OlHuOQ?view

hey. yeah, we have weekly meetings now to handle all these issues (prioritization, critical issues, regressions, etc.) but i'd like to set up a meeting (cc @pnkfelix) to make sure we take it all over smoothly and aren't missing anything.
specifically for the two critical issues about iteratior specialization that were already open, T-compiler was already dealing with those over the past weeks and we didn't have all the context.
right, yeah, that's the kind of discussion I wanted to encourage :)
Out of curiousity, what is motivation for renaming libs-impl to T-libs, rather than just having T-libs-api and T-libs-impl ?
because there's quite a few things that are neither strictly api or impl. e.g. rust-lang crates, documentation, reviewer guidelines, etc.

so we felt it was important there's a general 'T-libs' so things don't fall in the gap between them. originally the idea was a general T-libs and a specific T-libs-impl, but after some more thinking and discussions, we concluded it would work better to do the split with a general T-libs and specific T-libs-api

we also have some questions about compiler-contributors, since we now also have library-contributors.
shall we pick a time to meet? the next libs meeting is 2021-06-30T20:00:00+02:00 if that works. but we can also pick another time for this meeting.

There seems to be a bit of a problem with triagebot. I think that if someone did +T-libs before, it added T-libs then, and then that got renmaed to T-libs-api and triagebot added the new T-libs label as well.
#86183 is an example.
github also has some caching issues where search results inconsistenly return things with one or the other label when searching for "T-libs"

Mara said:

hey. yeah, we have weekly meetings now to handle all these issues (prioritization, critical issues, regressions, etc.) but i'd like to set up a meeting (cc pnkfelix) to make sure we take it all over smoothly and aren't missing anything.

hi @Mara if I'm not wrong you were saying explicitly here that T-compiler doesn't need to go over backports and things that are labelled T-libs, right?
I guess WG-prioritization needs to remove that from procedures and triagebot
yes! we handle these now every wednesday
ok
cc @apiraino @pnkfelix
@apiraino we can make a PR to forge and triagebot about that
so yesterday we talked about the two P-critical unsoundness issues with the iter specializations, and decided on how to continue there.
cool, will update our meetings. thanks @Mara
